item.title: Chief Executive visits Lisbon and Madrid in September
item.description:
The visit of the chief executive to Portugal, who was about to take place in the first half of this year, is finally scheduled. It will start on September 16, in Lisbon, and Sam Hou Fai will then travel to Madrid, on a visit that is scheduled to end on September 23, according to the Social Communication Office. The official program is not yet known, but meetings are expected at the highest level in Portugal
Catarina Pereira
The chief executive, Sam Hou Fai, will visit Portugal and Spain next month. Lisbon will be the first stopping point, starting September 16, with the leader of the mashes to move then to Madrid. The end of the visit to the Iberian Peninsula is scheduled for September 23, according to information released yesterday by the Social Communication Office. This will be Sam Hou Fai's first visit abroad as long as he took office as chief executive in December last year. The trip to Portugal was scheduled for the first half of this year, but was postponed due to the change of government in Portugal. The visit program is not yet known, but in Portugal Sam Hou Fai should meet high government positions, as well as to look for new bilateral cooperation roads, similar to what has been habitual in previous years. Regarding the MSAR delegation, it should include local entrepreneurs from industrial, commercial and financial sectors and “even certain companies in the interior of China,” according to the chief executive in May. At the time, he also announced that travel to Europe could include a passage through Spain, "to find more development projects between Macao and these countries." In Portugal - a country where the heads of the Executive of the MSAR are usually made their first visit abroad - several topics should be on the table. The recent detention of former Deputy Au Kam San in early August may be one of the issues covered between the parties. Portuguese Minister of State and Foreign Affairs, Paulo Rangel, told this newspaper at the time that the case “will deserve the best attention of the Portuguese authorities, from future meetings at the political level, in the spirit of the joint statement”. The question of restrictions on the assignment of residence to Portuguese may also be discussed. In March of this year, on a visit to the territory, it is recalled, the head of Portuguese diplomacy linked, in this regard, that he had spoken with Sam Hou Fai "on all the issues that are relevant to the relationship between Portugal and the mashes." "But, as it is a dialogue that is underway, I have a duty to give the opportunity we can - with the questions that have been raised from one part and the other - now to have space and time to build solutions," Paulo Rangel then added. The minister also indicated that the "follow-up of dialogue" staged with Sam Hou Fai will take place at a meeting of the Portugal-Raem Joint Commission, "which will be organized, in principle, in the second semester here in Macao." At the time, Rangel described as "very productive" the conversation with Sam Hou Fai, adding that he had "a lot of ability to be continued." This is expected to happen now in Portugal.

item.title: Free buses and metro on the day of elections for al
item.description:
No one will pay public transport on September 14, date of the elections to the Legislative Assembly. Not only the buses of the two operators, Transmac and TCM, but also the light meter will be up to the population, as a measure of convenience, adopted by the government, in the sense that there is a greater and more effective influx to voting assemblies. The free period will be between 8 am and 10 pm. On the other hand, the Al Commission of Electoral Affairs will organize, next Saturday, in Tap Seac Square, a ceremony at the beginning of the election campaign
Victor Rebelo
For the second time since there are elections for the Legislative Assembly in Macao, the population will enjoy public transport for free. To the suggestion of the Commission of Electoral Affairs of the Legislative Assembly (Caeal), the government responded affirmatively. Thus, between 8 am and 10 pm on September 14, the date of the electoral act, all passengers of the two bus operators, Transmac and TCM, and the light meter, can make trips throughout the city without having to pay ticket. "This measure is taken to facilitate the exercise of voters' voting rights, taking as reference the organization of the elections of the second Legislative Assembly [2001] and the free transport day in celebration of the 25th anniversary of the MSAR," said the president of Caeal. In addition, Seng Ioi Man mentioned, after another committee meeting, that “traffic day traffic measures are being coordinated and several electoral service posts will be created at different parts of the city, through the proposed coordination and support model, to facilitate those who will exercise their voting rights, consult the assemblies to which voters belong and provide transport services to specific needs”. According to the official, these measures of convenience are adopted so that the public “pay more attention to the electoral act, spreading the concepts of legal, fair, impartial and full elections”. At the same time, he reinforces, they serve "so that all voters can understand that the travel to voting assemblies is easy and that each vote is very important for the future of Macao's development." On the 30th, Saturday, the period of electoral propaganda, which will take place for 14 days, and Caeal believes that “all application lists are prepared to start votes for votes”, appealing to the same “take advantage of the propaganda platform” provided by CAEAL and make, under the law and according to the legal provisions, the various actions, the actions of propaganda, the actions of propaganda, the actions of propaganda propaganda propaganda "In order to obtain the support of voters."
Events to promote electoral interest After finishing another meeting of Caeal members, the body reported that, together with various public services, it will organize in the coming “multidimensional sensitization activities”, noting that, with the beginning of the electoral propaganda period, at 00h00 on August 30, all application lists will affix the posters of the political program in the panels available. "According to the experience, Tap Seac Square is the first choice of lists and so CAEAL will hold on August 29, between 20:30 and 22h00 at Tap Seac Square, outdoor cultural and recreational activities, especially the stage programs, in order to start the start of electoral propaganda events," said Seng Ioi Man, adding that the next day, the next day, adding that Resumes, at 9:30 am, the activities of the beginning of the campaign in the same square. In addition to the official launch ceremony of the election campaign, all applications, direct and indirect, may also take the stage to campaign or present the political program. There will also be interactive elements, where it is possible to simulate the vote, to mark with the commemorative stamp of the elections for the AL, play in the entertainment tents and receive official memories. In addition, tents will also be available for candidates to campaign. "This day is a good opportunity for civic education, welcome to the participation of residents with children," said the president of Caeal. On the eve of Elections, ie September 13, “we will continue to appeal diverse to voters to travel to the voting assemblies the next day, promoting, together with some public services, three propaganda activities in the communities,” he said. In concrete, the sessions will take place at 16h00 in the Jardim de Iao Hon, at 17h00 in the space next to Jardim Cidade das Flores, Taipa, and at 8:30 pm at Tap Seac Square. "Through recreational and cultural shows, it is intended that voters remember the 14 September and the importance of the vote, which will elect talents, supporting them to contribute to masters in the new legislature," he said.
Students will participate in voting simulation Meanwhile, for September 6, a voting simulation is scheduled, with the collaboration of the Directorate of Youth Education and Development Services (DSEDJ). Two voting assemblies are planned, one at TAP Seac, where students will “feel” what the voting process is like. As for the basis of political candidacy programs, CAEAL has already imprinted, both for direct and the indirect suffrage, and during the election campaign period will be made available to citizens for free, public services, government facilities, health centers, libraries, postal services and other postal stations, as well as in some public function buildings. Survey places will be announced later. The basis of political programs are also available on the electronic election page. Regarding the distribution of advertising sites, there are 18, having been made a draw for this purpose. Regarding irregularities, there are currently 19 cases. "These are suspected cases of having made an advertisement in advance, but they are still under analysis," he said. On the other hand, Caeal met with the “General Assembly of the elections for the AL”, and both parties have reached a consensus on decision criteria and discussed the work of finding the day after the election, “striving to ensure that the process is successfully completed and in accordance with the law”. To the media, Seng Ioi Man stated that, as regards the conception of voting assemblies, it is “being coordinated”. He pointed to two panels placed in the Caeal meetings room, the same as those who will be installed at the waiting line at the polling station, to remind all voters who have to use the proper stamp and that the use of the mobile phone, or other device, is prohibited, and may incur criminal responsibilities. Finally, the issue that public or private workers dismissed to vote. Seng Ioi Man will appeal again for those responsible for these services to facilitate the trip of employees to the voting assemblies. "If possible, they should adopt measures of convenience in terms of transportation, round trip, so that they can exercise their right, believing that the free public transport measure can also make life easier for all, not only to those who work that day," he concluded.

item.title: Inauguration of laboratories marks “new starting point”
item.description:
Sam Hou Fai spoke yesterday about the role of masters in national scientific and technological development, regarding the inauguration of the “new state reference laboratories”. The chief executive stated that the moment is a “new starting point” for the country
The “new reference laboratories of the state” were inaugurated yesterday, after the completion of the restructuring process, whose projects were approved by the Ministry of Science and Technology, in 2010 and 2018. During the inaugural ceremony, Sam Hou Fai stated that this moment marks a “new starting point” for China's scientific and technological development, according to the speech released by the social communication office. For the Chief Executive, the new laboratories should be “pioneers and entrepreneurs”, “take responsibility proactively and identify, manage and look for changes”. He also appealed to a "younger mindset" and "pragmatic measures" in the conversion of results and industrial development, implementing "more industry-university-investigation cooperation projects." He also said that the Government of MSAR is "preparing the creation of a government fund for industries and a guidance fund for the transformation of scientific and technological results." During the ceremony, identifying plates were assigned to the four state reference laboratories -State Reference Laboratory for Chinese Medicine, State Reference Laboratory in Large Analog and Mixed Circuits, Internet State Reference Laboratory for the Intelligent City and State Reference Laboratory for Lunar and Planetary Science -which at the beginning of 2025 was officially integrated. in the national system. In addition, Sam Hou Fai continued that Macau will develop the diversification of industries, giving “priority to the promotion of four major projects”, namely the Macao International Education City in Hengqin, the Macao Integrated Tourist and Cultural neighborhood, the Macao International Air Transport Hub on the West Border of Rio das Pearls and the Science and Technologies Research and Development Park. In particular, the leader of the masters hopes that the industrial park and the university city can contribute in a “unique” way to the construction of a leading country in science and technology and self -sufficient. The government leader also hopes that the MSAR can “actively promote the construction of the international corridor of scientific and technological innovation of the Great Guangdong-Hong Kong-Macau Bay, realizing a“ high quality development ”. Sam Hou Fai also reiterated that the government will coordinate “with renewed enthusiasm the integration of science and technology and education and education, qualified staff and industry.” He stressed, the times that have been airs are “crucial” to “broadly boost the construction” of the country and the “national revitalization” through a “Chinese style modernization”, recalling that the “one country, two systems” principle has entered a new phase. "In the process of improving integration in the conjuncture of national development, and serving it, Macau will strive to develop its strengths and respond to the needs of the country," he said during the speech. The head of the government thanked the support of the central government and its role in the scientific and technological development of the territory. He also expressed thanks to the Minister of Science and Technology, Yin Hejun, and the various sectors and researchers for their contribution in the scientific and technological areas over the years.
Minister wants Macau to attract more foreign investigators Chinese science and technology minister defended Macau that Macau should attract more foreign researchers, an appeal that will have the Lusophone countries among the targets, the rector of UCTM told Lusa. Yin Hejun pointed as a goal for the four reference laboratories of the state "create a good environment to attract qualified paintings." In a speech, he defended the need to “take advantage of Macao's environment and advantages”, namely the tradition of “overseas cooperation” to hire more “international talents”. On the sidelines of the ceremony, UCTM Rector Joseph Lee Hun-Wei told Lusa that the laboratory dedicated to Chinese medicine could benefit from greater international cooperation, "especially with Portuguese-speaking countries." But the leader stressed that the laboratory dedicated to lunar and planetary science “has recruited a large number of very good scientists in Europe,” including Portuguese astrobiologist Marta Filipa Simões.
P.M.

item.title: Buses with more passengers but less accessibility
item.description:
In the first semester, the number of passengers in TCM and Transmac transport services increased, in annual terms, to 113 million passengers, however the fleet for people with reduced mobility decreased. In addition, although there are fewer buses in circulation, both operators hired more drivers, reveal DSAT data
Pedro Milheirão
MSAR buses carried a total of 113 million passengers, between January and June, an increase of 2.25% compared to the same period last year, show the statistical data of the Traffic Affairs (DSAT) services. The daily average of passengers 626 thousand passengers. However, buses “with wheelchairs” or “relegated flooring” decreased 5.25% and 6.26%, respectively, to 883 and 974. The average daily number of bus frequency was 9,916, which corresponds to a growth of 5%. Career 25 was the most used, with a daily average of 25,838 passengers, followed by MT4 (25,615) and career 3 (24,018). On the other hand, the least used at 103x (529), H1 (685) and 37 (981). Three stops were also added to the Macao Peninsula, which now has 258, another three in the mud (135) and one in Coloane (51). Between January and June, Transmac's number of vehicles increased by 3% to 440, and TCM's dropped 12% to 544 in annual terms. Although the total of buses decreased by 5.66% to 984, both dealers hired more drivers for their fleets. Transmac added 24 conductors to a total of 689, while TCM added 61, with 819 at the end of June. Each of the bus operators added a career to its services in the first half, in relation to the same period of 2024. Transmac had 33 and TCM with 56, and careers 61, 103X and 701x are explored jointly by both concessionaires. Until June, bus 26 was the one that most kilometers traveled a day, accounting for 46.73km, followed by 21a (44.66km) and 102x (42.73km). In turn, the H1 was the one that least traveled, with only 3.64km daily. Career 4 recorded 6.28km per day, followed by 2a, with 8.30km. With the exception of the buses that work for 24 hours, the number 51 had the longest service hours, operating for 19 hours and 30 minutes. 9 and 9th registered 19 hours and 25 minutes, while buses 5, 17 and AP1 worked daily for 19 hours and 20 minutes.
More than 271 million patacas at tickets In the first six months of the year, both bus concessionaires accumulated more than 271 million patacas in ticket revenues. TCM raised approximately 142 million, while Transmac pocketed about 129 million. During the period under analysis, TCM had personnel expenses above 122 million Patacas, while Transmac registered almost 102 million on social charges. In addition, TCM received 156 million on support, while Transmac received 178 million, according to DSAT data. In approximately 10 years, the bus -driven environments -powered buses have replaced almost the entire fleet -powered diesel. At the end of 2015, of the 810 public buses in circulation, 790 (97.53%) were moved to diesel. At the end of the first half of this year, 929 vehicles (94.41%) out of a total of 984 were ecological. By vehicles “moved to environmental energies”, DSAT has natural gas buses and careers with extenders of autonomy. The number of environmental buses of the environment did not change compared to last year, however 23 diesel -powered vehicles were removed. By the end of the semester, the “bus location” application was discharged by 2,677,430 people. The number of vehicles equipped with passenger number estimation system remained 382.

item.title: Trump threatens China with 200% rates
item.description:
US President Donald Trump threatened China with about 200% tariffs on Chinese products entering the United States if Beijing does not accelerate rare land exports. "They have to give us awhelming. If they don't, then we'll impose about 200%rates. But I think we'll have no problem with that," Trump said in the presence of South Korean counterpart Lee Jae-Myung during an impressions in the oval room. China is the world's leading producer of rare land, which are used in the manufacture of essentials for the automotive, electronic and weaponry industries. However, in early April, the Chinese state imposed a license to export these strategic materials, a decision seen as a measure of retaliation against US customs rights. Beijing and Washington then began a large -scale trade war, responding to each other to the increase in the other's customs rights, which reached 125% and 145%, respectively. Since then, negotiations between the world's two largest powers have mitigated tensions and the Chinese government has pledged to accelerate licensing issuance to several US companies. "I think we have a great relationship with China, I spoke very recently to President XI [Jinping] and at some point this year we should visit China," Trump added. Despite recognizing that Beijing has “mango assets,” he stressed that Washington also has “a few amazing trushes,” but he doesn't want to play these assets because if he did, he would “destroy China,” warned the US president without specifying. US and Chinese employees have gathered three times in recent months to resolve a series of business relationships. At the end of these meetings, the two countries agreed to maintain customs rights that impose each other at 30% and 10%, respectively, for a period of 90 days, which has been extended twice, the last until November. Beijing, for its part, obtained a flexibility of customs rights on exports of high precision semiconductors in the United States, whose sale to Chinese companies has been progressively restricted, namely during the administration of Joe Biden (2021-2025).
JTM WITH LUSA

item.title: Macau and Beijing reinforce health cooperation
item.description:
The Secretary for Social Affairs and Culture has moved to the Chinese capital to reinforce health exchanges. LAM had meetings with several medical entities, having visited the first hospital of the University of Beijing, with which it intends to increase the existing collaboration, in view of the formation of qualified frames
A delegation headed by the Secretary for Social Affairs and Culture visited Beijing and had meetings with the National Health Commission (CNS), the state administration of traditional Chinese medicine and the first hospital of the University of Beijing (PHUP). The objective of the displacement of O LAM was to achieve an exchange and consensus around various topics, in order to deepen the cooperation between the interior of China and the health of the health area and to promote the integration of the construction of the “healthy city” in the context of national development. During the stay in the Chinese capital, the entourage visited CNS, and participated in a lecture with several entities. During the session, the secretary presented the development of the area in Macao, namely regarding differentiated care, primary care and health promotion. The ruler took the opportunity to thank the confidence deposited in the organization of the joint meeting of the domes of the health administration of China, Hong Kong and Macau, which will take place in December this year, and expressed the desire to further deepen cooperation with CNS. The delegation also maintained a thematic meeting with the subdirector of the National Administration of Traditional Chinese Medicine, having discussed the position and role of mashes in the national strategy for the development of traditional Chinese medicine, as well as the path to its industrialization and internationalization. In addition, LAM moved to PHUP, having pointed out the collaboration between Macau and that university unit. Since February 2024, health services have performed with PHUP 35 joint consultations within the general internal medicine, which had the participation of more than 2,600 people. Both parties agreed to progressively broaden cooperation to more medical institutions, and to reinforce face -to -face academic exchange and technical collaboration, in order to promote the formation of qualified paintings and raising the technological level. The CNS director praised the work developed by the health government in the area of ​​health, since its inauguration, and presented the latest reform of the health system in the country, participation in global health management, the treatment of the epidemic of communicable diseases, among other works. Law Haichao said he hoped Macau can, through concrete measures, optimize the medical and health service system, reinforce the prevention and joint control of transmissible diseases between Guangdong, Hong Kong and Macau, further develop the unique role of “interior connection” and the advantages of international qualified frames.
V.R.

item.title: INSIDED SCHOOLS TO CREATE HEALTH MANAGEMENT MECHANISM
item.description:
Given the increase in number of cases of chikungunya fever, the direction of education and youth development services urges schools to create a health monitoring mechanism. On the other hand, it asks parents to be aware. The objective is to safeguard health and collective security
Macau registered the ninth case imported of chikungunya fever during the current year. The patient, a 53-year-old resident worker, is currently in Zhuhai, being his state stable. In response to the notification, health services (SSM) will soon proceed to the work of chemical elimination of mosquitoes, in risk zones near the Fai Chi Kei Health Center. Following the increased positive reaction situations to the virus, transmitted by mosquitoes, which have been verified in the territory and when it is about to start another academic year, the direction of Youth Education and Development Services (DSEDJ) has a warning to students and parents of students. DSEDJ has urged educational establishments to rigorously execute health authorities guidelines, including the reinforcement of cleaning and increasing the ability to prevent mosquitoes. In a statement, the body points out that "after the beginning of classes, schools need to create a health monitoring mechanism", and they will have to "immediately appropriate treatments for teachers or students with suspicious symptoms." As for parents, he says, "if they notice the less good physical state of their children, such as fever, joint pain and rash, among other symptoms of chikungunya fever, will have to take them to the doctor as quickly as possible and to impose health management according to the diagnosis," in order to jointly safeguard health and collective safety. " On the other hand, DSEDJ expects parents to pay more attention to their children's exercise and rest time, and to help them “adjust” physical and mental health. In this regard, he suggested that they assist their children in defining reasonable studies, in the creation of exercise habit and maintaining a balanced rest time. The DSEDJ also takes the opportunity to point out that, to ensure a “without starting” school year 2025/2026. Also warns parents to help their children as soon as possible in preparing for the academic year, while schools need to review pedagogical facilities in advance and create a healthy school environment. Finally, given that Macau is in a time of typhoons, and given the situation of traffic that usually comes at the time of the beginning of classes, DSEDJ underlines that it coordinated with the competent services to elaborate response plans, appealing to parents to plan the course as soon as possible.
V.R.

item.title: Artists apply “tautology” in show at Creative
item.description:
The use of tautology as a significant “deeply inspiring” technique leads several artists to expose at Creative. The show, which marks the 22 years of the gallery, presents works by 24 authors of Macau
Victor Rebelo
Works by local artists will be exhibited from Thursday at the Center of Macau Creative Industries (Creative), publicizing works that carry to art the concept of “tautology”, which consists of repeating the same idea in different words. The show is part of the celebration of Creative's 22nd anniversary and gives vision to 24 authors, all members of Creative, namely Alice Costa (Lili), Angel Chan, Coco Cheong Ut Man, Cristina Lu, David Chio, Denis Murrell, Elisa Vilaça, Eloi Scarva, Gigi Lee, Irene Chio, Justin Chiang, Justin Ung, Ken C.I. Chau, Law Sao I, Leong Leng, Li Li, Liesl Lee, Lúcia Lemos, M.CHOW, Maria João das, Mavin Zin, Ng Cheok Ieng and Yaya goes. To the Jornal Tribuna de Macao, some of the artists said, in general, what they will present. In the synopsis of his works, which will be facilities, Lúcia Lemos points out that "the film that lives between the shell and the egg white, protects its food content and regulates gaseous exchanges with the outside, continuing its formation and culminating in a food of huge protein content." “Marvel by the film transformed into white and opaque petal after drought, suddenly I imagined creating tropical spontaneous flowers,” he adds. Eloi Scarva, in turn, participates with a “new piece of transfer”, where he applies a “Inkjet” image on a wooden surface worked with a special liquid that transfers the image to the wood. “The image is a digitally made composition made of discarded black and white photographs, that is, those that do not select for photographic work, reuse in this new digital composition”. The artist admits that the final product is a kind of “face made of faces”, mentioning that there will be two pieces, “one the negative of the other”. Elisa Vilaça has confided to JTM that her work will be represented on a 60 × 60 screen, through a mask framed in a context made from natural materials collected in the gardens of Macau. "Starting from the theme that will body the exhibition, the reasoning of work is based on the analysis and reciprocity between reality, idea and representation underlying the work," he said, considering that "sharing the same perspective of Kosuth, the work presented is a tautology, since it represents my intention as an artist." It is an art “that defines me as a person and portrays the human being in his relationship with nature,” he says. Finally, it remembers that there is “a connection to the origins, traditions and preservation of Portuguese culture”. In the curatorial text of the exhibition, by Mann Chow, it is described that artists interpret tautology through various different means and techniques. "His works, based on even numbers, explored the concepts of repetition and ambiguity under the synonym's umbrella." In everyday language, “we often use tautology unintentionally,” says the document. However, he adds, "in the field of art it can be a profoundly inspiring expressive technique," so this exhibition explores the possibilities of tautology: "Is it a restriction or liberation? Is it a meaningless repetition or a form of self -affirmation with hidden meanings?" Through this language, artists challenge viewers' expectations regarding “meaning” by repeatedly presenting similar elements, leading them to question whether their understandings are always constructed of constantly repeated language and symbols. “Perhaps, only through repetition can we discover these subtle differences,” says Creative. It is in this context that the exhibition aims to draw public attention to pair-based works, which exploit the concepts of “repetition” and “ambiguity” under the “synonym” umbrella. The inauguration will take place between 18:30 and 20:30.

item.title: Inquiry reveals decline in business between 54% of SMEs
item.description: The Macao Sustadement and Economics Alliance, a association linked to the “Jiangmen countrymen”, released yesterday the results of an inquiry with a view to noticing the business environment of small and medium enterprises (SMEs). Of a total of 1,037 SMPs surveyed, 54% said they had registered a tendency to decrease in business volume, and respondents consider “renowned market competition” and “high operating costs” such as the dominant restrictions on their development. In addition, 62% confessed that they do not know the support measures currently implemented by the government. In this aspect, some consider that the information on the presentation of order to benefit from the support measures are not transparent, and the request procedures are complex. On the other hand, the study reveals that more than 70% of the companies inquired are available or even promoting digital operations. However, only 9% effectively completed this digital transformation. Among these, most are only in the early attempts, which, for the association, shows that there is a disparity between the will of the SMEs and its ability to achieve this objective. In addition, after being heard by 15 academics, the SME interviewed won 51.4 points, from a scale from zero to 100, regarding the general business environment of Macao, results lower than the neighboring regions. As a solution, the Association suggested creating a “One Stop” platform regarding PME policies to simplify procedures and launch a marketing financial support. In addition, the Association defended the expansion of the scope of policy dissemination and the implementation of an effectiveness assessment mechanism.

item.title: “Most common” electronic means in the transfer of illicit funds
item.description:
Although the “exchange of cards without/with reduced game activity” leads for the second year in a row the top of the suspicious transaction reports table, the truth is that the “use of online banks/Internet-related transactions” was the one that recorded “a more significant increase” in 2024, according to the financial information office, and 555 cases were verified. The body says it is a sign that "the transfer of illicit funds is increasingly common through electronic technology." In the general calculation, a total of 5,245 STR arrived, reflecting an annual increase of 13.7% and 78.3% compared to the pre-pound period
Pedro Milheirão
The “change of cards without/with reduced game activity” again led for the second year consecutive reports of suspicious transactions (STR, in the English acronym), totaling 1,569 cases, a 24% increase compared to 1,282 registered in 2023. According to the report of the financial information office (GIF) for 2024, the rise is proportional to the “significant increase in the number of cases of suspicious transactions in the game sector in the last two years ”. Despite being first, it was the “use of online banks/internet -related transactions” that recorded “a more significant increase”, as the body stresses. 555 cases were counted, however, it is not possible to make a comparison with 2023, as this year this type of cases was included in the "others", along with other characteristics, such as "possible correspondence with the" Watch-List "screening system or other black lists," transactions with unknown provenance funds "and" tried, but failed transactions. " According to the GIF, this feature was common in the STR reported by financial institutions, "reflecting that, currently, the transfer of illicit funds through electronic technology is increasingly common." “Background transfers through check, promising notes or bank transfer,” in turn rose 29% to 599, while “suspicious electronic transfers” also rose, in this case 16% to 411. “The“ cash deposits of high amounts of origin ”increased 10 to 796. During the last year, there were also 141 cases related “with other crimes” (+20%), ascending a total of 843. In addition, 100 cases of “use of multibanco, telephone board, cash deposits” (633) were reported than the previous year, representing an increase of 19%. In 2024, the GIF also reported 2,723 cases of “other” activities, 337 more than the previous year (2,386). Overall, throughout the year the GIF received 5,245 STR, reflecting an annual increase of 13.7%. The increase was even more visible compared to 2019, as there was a 78.3%increase. Chu Un, GIF coordinator, an organism that is now integrated into the Unit Police Services, says in the report that the data “reflects the challenges of supervision resulting from the dynamism of Macao economic activities and demonstrate the high degree of confidence of reporting institutions in the professional capacity of GIF”. “Despite adjusting the GIF structure, the number of suspicious transactions participations continued to grow two digits, demonstrating that the operators of the different Macau sectors have been reinforcing their awareness of the risk and sensitivity to the risk,” says Chu Un. In particular, the number of STR from the financial sector rose 23.7% to 1,097, according to the GIF report, which considered it to be a "significant increase." The financial industry was responsible for about one fifth of reports (21%) and other institutions by 311 (5.9%). However, most STR continued to be reported by the game industry, in a set of 3,837 (73%). In 2024, the GIF received another 406 reports from game operators (12%) than the previous year (3,431). In 2024, a total of 142 reports were re -enhanced to the Public Prosecution Service, a 22% rise in annual terms. The GIF suspects that "some cases are related to the crime of slopping", with "the possibility that their illicit funds are transferred and bleached through the Macao financial system." STR's main form of participation in 2024 was online, with 91% of reports (4,794) to be digitally submitted. The concessionaires submitted all their reports by this means, while the financial sector institutions sent 957 (87%). Last year, the GIF continued to promote global optimization of the computer system and the construction of cybersecurity, “with the aim of raising the effectiveness of the analysis of financial information and responding effectively to increasingly complex security challenges”, can read in the report. Main work included, among others, the “updating of the STR online participation system”. Perspective this year, the coordinator, Chu Un, stresses that the GIF will “build a high and solid defense line against capital bleaching [as well as] establish and improve the financial risk prevention and resolution mechanism in order to create a secure financial barrier”.
Information sharing and international collaboration "Capital bleaching phenomena, terrorism financing and financing the proliferation of weapons of massive destruction are not only in a jurisdiction. Capital flows often involve various regions," the report says. According to the recommendations of the Financial Action Group (GAFI), "different jurisdictions, in addition to identifying and evaluating the risks (…) should also update them regularly to maintain the risk assessment updated." The GIF claims to have continued “to fulfill its member duties in international organizations against capital laundering”, such as the Asia-Pacific group against capital laundering and the Egmont Group. The cabinet also believes it has established "a long -term solid base for the construction of a more efficient international financial security network." On the other hand, and according to Gafi reviews, an intergovernmental organization that investigates capital whites and organized crime, updated in July, the MSAR is still poorly effective in the investigation, seizure of revenues and sanctions on money laundering crimes, requiring “fundamental improvements”. Regarding the combat of money laundering associated with terrorism, reporting suspicious transactions and the application of preventive measures by financial institutions, “non -financial companies and designated professions” (DNFBP, English acronym) and “virtual asset service suppliers” (VASP), performance is moderate and the gafaf indicates that “great improvements” are needed. By the end of the last year, the GIF has signed 33 memorandums of understanding with other financial information units from various countries and jurisdictions, including Portugal. “Cooperation mechanisms in the exchange of information” were also established, “in order to reinforce the effectiveness of preventing and combating the crime of laundering capital and related crimes,” says the report. Throughout 2024, the GIF received 48 requests for information and made 60, having received 19 occasions and made available on 17, within the scope of international cooperation. Created in 2006, GIF is an administrative financial information unit, responsible for participating in the prevention and combating criminal activities related to capital laundering, terrorism financing and financing the proliferation of weapons of massive destruction.

item.title: Part of the Portuguese sidewalk can be replaced in the alley of Lilau
item.description:
The AMI is negotiating with residents and the condominium management company about a work to replace the Portuguese sidewalk pavement in Beco do Lilau with non -slip granite, with the contract with an area of ​​about 12 square meters. According to AMI, the IC has already been consulted on this proposal for optimization. To be completed, the work also requires “consensus”, presentation of the request to DSAT and “Light Verde” of the “Road Works Coordination Group”, noted the body
The Institute for Municipal Affairs (AMI) is planning to extend the granite floor used on the Lilau Beco Ramp to the Lancil do Passeio, linked to Rua da Barra - which means that the existing Portuguese sidewalk may disappear. The work involves an area of ​​12 square meters, and the body said that the idea is that the materials remain consistent throughout the ramp. To the Jornal Tribuna de Macao, the body said that their materials already take into account the harmonization with the surrounding landscape, and at the same time allow a better non -slip effect for this street section that is going down. According to the perspective plant sent by AMI to this newspaper, the area of ​​the work is currently fully paved with Portuguese sidewalk, and the contract then consists of replacing the Portuguese sidewalk pavement with granite. As for the Portuguese sidewalk in Largo do Lilau, AMI assured that the work will not cause any change. It is recalled that Lilau's square and alley are part of the historic center, classified as a UNESCO World Heritage Site. For this reason, AMI stated that it had already consulted the opinion of the Cultural Institute (IC) regarding the respective optimization proposal. When consulting another AMI plant, it is clear that, in the area of ​​the work, except a small part of the Portuguese sidewalk (not linked to Rua da Barra) that will be preserved, most of the sidewalk will be replaced by gray granite and non-slip red granite, as well as red brick that is currently being used on the side of the alley. According to AMI, all stone materials will comply with the size and colors of the existing materials there. In this respect, he recalled, there were residents who pointed to the possibility of the vehicles skidded in rain time on the floor in the alley of Lilau, linked to Rua da Barra. Ensuring that it has been following this subject continuously - including through the use of non -slip ink for some years to improve the situation - the AMI has lamented, however, that this measure has “limited effect”. Since the holding of the street section pavement contract involved will be an impact on the entries and exits of residents' vehicles, AMI indicated that it is currently “communicating actively” with the condominium management company and residents, to coordinate the proposal to execute the work, in order to reduce the impact on those who inhabit. "When there is consensus, AMI will submit a request to the Directorate of Services for Traffic Affairs (DSAT). Only after approval at the Road Works Coordination Group meeting can the concrete plans for execution of the work be implemented," said AMI. On the same subject, in turn, the IC stated that “actively collaborates” with the respective work of IAM and had already expressed opinions in the scope of protection of cultural heritage in relation to the proposal in question. To the Jornal Tribuna de Macao, the IC also indicated that, later,, along with the AMI, to proceed to further evaluate the conditions on site, studying the feasibility of the proposal of optimization.

item.title: Chief exalts “spirit of resistance against Japanese aggression”
item.description:
Until September 24, the forum complex hosts a photographic exhibition about the 80th anniversary of China's victory in the Japanese aggression resistance war. At the inauguration ceremony, the chief executive argued that "we need to guide ourselves by the spirit of resistance against Japanese aggression, strengthen our belief in patriotism and love Macao", as well as "to have the wisdom of daring to change." Sam Hou Fai also highlighted the role of Macao's “compatriots” in the war. Already the director of the connecting cabinet urged all communities of Macao to “focus on boosting the economy”
The “Exhibition of the 80th Anniversary of the victory in the Chinese people's resistance to Japanese aggression and the anti -fascist World War” was inaugurated yesterday, organized by the Government of MSAR and patent in the complex of the Commercial Cooperation Platform between China and Portuguese -speaking countries until September 24. Prior to the visit of the exhibition guests of honor, an inauguration ceremony took place. At the time, the chief executive, Sam Hou Fai, began stressing that, in the 14 years of resistance against Japanese aggression, "the Macao compatriots, permanently sharing the destination of the country, played an irreplaceable and unique role, made contributions that will be to history and wrote their own resistance epic against Japanese aggression." In the speech, the leader of the MSAR recalled that they “reacted positively” ahead defended by the Communist Party of China, having, early in the incident of 18 September, created “enthusiastically” groups of patriotic salvation to raise funds and promote the resistance war. Specifically, he stressed that after the occupation of Canton and Hong Kong, despite Macau was surrounded and almost coming to an “isolated island”, thanks to his unique position and the joint efforts of all spheres of society, he became a port of shelter for hundreds of compatriots and refugees that arrived from neighboring areas and also an important channel to rescue cultural celebrities and patriots in Hong arrested in Hong Kong, which "demonstrates the national spirit that is to face together the national crisis and remain united in good and bad times." "The macao compatriots, consistent with the 'rise and fall of the nation to say respect to all', have become an indispensable force in the torrent of resistance," he said. In this sense, he stressed that the realization of the exhibition aims to “remember history and pay tribute to the martyrs”, also serving as “a solemn commitment to value peace and create a great future”. Stressing that the victory in the war was "an important turning point for the Chinese nation, from suffering to rejuvenation," Sam Hou Fai also describes victory as "an important spiritual strength for us today, in the new journey of building a large country and national revitalization." “Given the great changes, unprecedented in the last 100 years, we need to guide ourselves by the spirit of resistance against Japanese aggression, strengthen our belief in patriotism and love Macau, inspire mission and responsibility in the New Age, have the courage to face challenges and difficulties, as well as to dare to change and be good in innovation,” he defended. In this sense, the leader of the Macao audience for the defense of the “a country” principle and taking advantage of “two systems” to “create a new conjuncture in the midst of change and further contributing to Macao's force to national development, mutual learning between civilizations and world peace”. Noting that the cause “a country, two systems” in Macau is entering a new phase of development, the boss assured that the celebration of the 80th anniversary of the victory in the war will be used to widely promote the national spirit, with patriotism as a core. In this respect, and citing President XI Jinping, he stressed that "the story is the best textbook and the best reflection agent." “We will continue to perform a series of commemorative activities for the Macao compatriots, especially the younger generation, to remember the suffering and glory of the nation, remember the dedication and sacrifice of our ancestors and transform historical memory into spiritual strength to our contemporaries, inspiring the whole society to remember history and to transmit it alive from generation to generation, to join new chapters of practice. "One country, two systems" in Macao and making new contributions to national revitalization, "he said.
Inherit “the red genes” In turn, the director of the Central Government's connection office in the MSAR, Zheng Xincong, pointed out that Macau was “never absent” in the War of Resistance, with “Macao compatriots” to strive “with all his heart” in national salvation, which “constitutes a vivid interpretation of patriotic sentiment and national justice”. Zheng Xincong found that since the beginning of the year, all sectors have “actively organized” a series of activities to commemorate the ephemeris. According to example, the exhibition encompasses the war of representative figures such as Ye Ting, Ke Lin and Xian Xinghai, the “precious collections” such as the “Special Edition of Aid” edited by the Macao's four sectors, as well as the old photographs showing participation in the war effort of groups such as the Chinese youth ambulances body, support for Macao, support for the support for the support for the support for Macao, Rescue of cultural and patriotic figures such as Fan Changjiang and Xia Yan, and the aid to the anti-Japanese activities of the Dong Jiang Column Corps, "all historical testimonies that Macao shared the joys and sufferings with the homeland." In the same line, it also emphasized that the current and future period is “crucial” to advance the construction of a strong country and the cause of the great revitalization of the Chinese nation through modernization, arguing that performing a better development of Macao and contributing more to the construction of a strong country is an important mission of practice “one country, two systems”. “All communities of Macao are expected to profoundly learn the spirit consecrated in President Xi Jinping's important speeches, inherit and develop the great spirit of resistance against aggression, take advantage of the 'one country, two systems' system, maintain firmly the national security and stability of Macao, focus on boosting the economy, promoting development, and constantly opening a new panorama of high quality development for the cause Country, two systems', ”said Zheng Xincong. In addition, he added that young people are "the hope and future of Macao" and "the living force to build Macao and the nation." In this sense, it expects young locals to “inherit the red genes”, “perpetuate red blood”, firmly establish the great aspiration of participating in the strengthening of the Chinese nation, whether the builders and successors of the cause “a country, two systems”, and “let the youth shine in the construction of a strong country in the vast space of a beautiful Macao”. Noting that the show “is not only a deep retrospective of the extraordinary times of the past, but also an aspiration and adherence to peace”, Zheng Xincong called on the public to, learning from history and looking into the future, implementing the “country, two systems” principle, to safeguard the environment of peace and development “conquered with so much effort”, and “writing a new chapter in the realization of the dream together” together Chinese of great revitalization of the Chinese nation. ” Yesterday there was also a ceremony of delivery of commemorative medals of the 80th anniversary of the ephemeris.

item.title: Community neighborhoods will host artists from the Lusofonia Festival
item.description:
There are still no names of invited artists for the musical activities of the Lusophony Festival, but there is a certainty of two "headwaters" for each of the Lusofonia weekends, one of which should come from Portugal again. The success of the bet on two weekends made in the 2024 edition leads to the organization to keep the event model for this year. The popular party will take place in two periods, from October 24 to 26, and from October 31 to November 2. In parallel, the Cultural Institute also organizes the meeting in Macau - Festival of Arts and Culture between China and Portuguese -speaking countries ”, which will feature a first“ show in the community ”on October 23rd, in the IAO Hon neighborhood
Victor Rebelo
The 28th edition of the Lusofonia Festival returns this year for six days, on two consecutive weekends, after the 2024 experience was considered positive by the organization of the event, in charge of the Cultural Institute (IC). The first period of the popular party will take place between October 24 and 26, and the second between October 31 and November 2, always on Friday, Saturday and Sunday, on the beach Avenue where the Taipa Museum houses are located. Therefore, it will be six days of celebration, where there will be no shortage of musical action, popular games and matracks, as well as food and drink stalls and stands with handicrafts and other articles representing countries or regions of Lusophone expression. The names of the artists invited to the musical shows, which constitute one of the most important parts of the festival program, have not yet been released, which should only happen at the press conference, scheduled for September. Moreover, the associations that usually participate in the festivity already know some points of the program, after a first meeting that kept with the IC, also having details about the other event that is again promoted in parallel with the Festival of Lusofonia, which is the “Meeting in Macao - Festival of Arts and Culture between China and Portuguese -speaking countries”, also under the same Session of the IC and will be released in the same presentation. Lusophony Festival. According to the Jornal Tribuna de Macau, the model of the two events remains virtually unchanged compared to previous years, varying only the names of artists who will participate in the musical shows. The budget will be equally similar to the past edition. For Lusophony, there will be 10 solo interpreters, in band, or traditional dance and singing groups, divided into the same number by the two weekends, and there will be two “head of carta”, one for each party period, on Saturday night, and one of them must come from Portugal, as has happened usually. In 2024 came Fernando Daniel and 2023 Carlão, with the expectation of being able to come in 2025 a singer. JTM knows that there are some strong names on the table, which are being negotiated, but there is no final decision yet. It should be noted that the artists who will come abroad will join several musicians from Macau, many of whom, with a lot of experience, have added quality to the festival's musical shows program. In addition to Portugal and Macao, nine more countries or Lusophone regions will be represented in the shows to take place at the amphitheater of houses in the museum, in the afternoon and evening. They are: Brazil, Angola, Mozambique, Cape Verde, Guinea Bissau, Equatorial Guinea, Sao Tome and Principe, East Timor and Goa Damão and Diu. Some of these groups will be made up of bands. Following the same system of previous years, IC will take advantage of the presence in Macao of artists invited to the Lusophony Festival, to also monetize them in the “Traditional Music and Dance Shows in the community”, integrated into the “Meeting between China and Portuguese -speaking countries”. Thus, four of those who will come to the first period of the festivity, except for the “headlof”, as this will only give a concert, will be displayed in places of the already chosen city. One of these stages will be installed in the Iao Hon neighborhood, with the first scheduled performance for the eve of the Lusophony festival, October 23, between 18:30 and 21h00. A group of traditional dances from China, Guangdong Province, will accompany the other artists in the 23rd show, repeating the performance on 30 October, as will be present at the opening ceremony of the Lusophony Festival and the meeting, on the 24th, Friday, at 19h00, at Taipa Museum Houses. For the remaining exhibitions in the community, the organization has also decided the places where the public can watch the events: Leisure Zone of the Lok Yeong Fa Yuen Building, next to Lam Mau, and in the side spaces of Jardim Cidade das Flores, in Taipa. Last year, the places went to the Carmo Fair and the ruins of São Paulo. Regarding the programming of the meeting, several activities are planned, beyond the musical shows, such as exhibitions, cinema and a book fair.

item.title: Korea bets on culture in search of impulse for growth
item.description:
South Korean entertainment companies, which “surf” in the Korean wave, or Hallyu, are striving to widen global range, while Asia's fourth largest economy is betting on cultural exports at a time of growing protection barriers to traditional manufacturers. Although it is growing rapidly from a low base, thanks to the substantial support of the government and the high visibility in the world landscape with some recent successes, the sector's contribution to the economy is still just a fraction of the transforming industry. The Samsung and Hyundai Industry Giants House is delighting in the success of Boys Band BTS, the winning movie of a Oscar, “Parasite”, from the “Round 6” series “The Vegetarian”, whose author Han Kang won the Nobel Prize for Literature in 2024, and, more recently, the musical Maybe Happy Ending. India, Latin America and the Middle East, in particular, are new promising markets for Korean cultural products that have been revealed global hits, they said executives of major producers in interviews with Reuters. “The Latin American region, recognized as the cradle of Latin music, is a key focus area,” said Jason Jaesang Lee, executive director of the K-Pop Hybe agency, who manages the BTS, featured his return planned for next spring. The agency is also holding auditions in Latin America to release another boys Band, after the US -based Katseye group debut last year, whose six members come from four countries. "It's time to re -examine Hallyu's definition," Lee said. "If the content is created abroad, but produced by a Korean company, or even by a foreign entity with Korean capital, I believe it should still be considered part of Hallyu." Still, cultural exports are unlikely to replace the traditional transforming industry in the near future. South Korea Intellectual Property Exports (PI), from music and movies to games, more than tripled over the past decade, reaching $ 9.85 billion by 2024, but representing only a fraction of goods exports, which increased 13%, reaching $ 696.2 billion, according to Central Bank data. Another company that is expanding the global business this year is CJ ENM, producer of “parasite”, which began to provide K-Damas for the Middle East and North Africa through a partnership with a regional streaming platform in June. In the case of the Middle East, “we see this market as a promising long term, because Hallyu's popularity is high among the youngest generation,” said Sean Cho, executive vice president of the global business division. In the main markets in Japan, Southeast Asia and the United States, the company is widening partnerships, more recently with Amazon Prime Video, to offer joint productions that combine Korean elements with local culture, Cho added. For the game industry, a source of income that represents more than half of South Korea's intellectual exports and is famous for Krafton's award-winning PUBG: Battlegrounds, India promises to be the next growing market, although it represents only a tenth of the South Korean market. "The India Game Market is still early in comparison with other advanced countries," said Sean Hyunil Sohn, executive director of Game Editor Kraftton India, which plans to explore growth potential, adding new genres and types of games. President Lee Jae Myung has promised support and investment to make South Korea in a “great cultural power,” with the aim of expanding the market to 300 billion wons in value and exports to 50 billion wons by 2030. "But we can't leave it in the hands of individual companies," he said in a recent talk show. "The government will play the role of establishing a solid foundation, and it begins now." Big Five refer to music categories, dramas, webtoons, beauty and food products, which are key elements in President Lee's efforts to reposition South Korea as a cultural power. For long -term success, sector experts and even the Central Bank have appealed to legislative structures to help national companies compete with global giants such as Netflix.
JTM with international agencies
